comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: the disaster occurred in May, not My. Bain spells out "Mount" in his caption.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq and Wystan:  Thanks.  We'll fix this typo next time we update.

comment.author: 51948588@N08
comment._content: May 8, 1914 has not been an eruption of Mount Etna, but a violent earthquake. A violent shock to the almost total destruction of the town of Linera and neighboring villages (Cosentini, Mortara and Passopomo) in the lower eastern slopes of Etna. The victims were seventy.

comment.author: 63860770@N07
comment._content: Thanks Massimo1989, it was an earthquake. I found a few old newspaper stories that said a new crater or crack in appeared in Mt. Etna and lava could be seen, but I didn't see anything saying the volcano itself destroyed anything.
